Container.Name: HandBrake
Container.Overview: HandBrake is a tool for converting video from nearly any format to a selection of modern, widely supported codecs. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client. A fully automated mode is also available: drop files into a watch folder and let HandBrake process them without any user interaction. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 80MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]NOTE:[/b][/span] For the container to have access to your optical drive(s), you need to allow access to the proper device (usually [b][i]/dev/sr0[/i][/b]) by adding the parameter [b][i]--device DEV[/i][/b] in the [i]Extra Parameters[/i] field (shown when [i]Advanced View[/i] is enabled). For example, if your optical drive is at [b][i]/dev/sr0[/i][/b], you need to add [b][i]--device /dev/sr0[/i][/b].

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Watch Directory
Config.Description: This is the watch folder of the automatic video converter. Any video copied into this folder will be automatically converted by HandBrake.<br>Container path: /watch

Config.Name: Output Directory
Config.Description: This is the default output folder for converted videos. Also used by the automatic video converter.<br>Container path: /output

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated. This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup. Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes. GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

Config.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
Config.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Preset
Config.Description: Preset used by the automatic video converter. Identification of the preset must follow the format 'CATEGORY/PRESET NAME'. Name of all available presets can be seen via the HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Format
Config.Description: Video container format used by the automatic video converter for output files. This is typically the video filename extension.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Keep Source Files
Config.Description: Set to 0 to remove successfully converted videos from the watch folder, 1 to keep them.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Non-Video File Action
Config.Description: Set to <b><i>ignore</i></b> to ignore non-video files from the watch folder, or set to <b><i>copy</i></b> to copy them as-is to the output folder.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Non-Video File Extensions
Config.Default: jpg jpeg bmp png gif txt nfo
Config.Description: Space-separated list of file extensions to be considered as not being videos. Most non-video files are properly rejected by HandBrake. However, some files, like images, are convertible by HandBrake even if they are not video files.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Output directory
Config.Description: Root directory where converted videos should be written.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Output Subdirectory
Config.Description: Subdirectory of the output folder into which converted videos should be written.<ul><li>Leave value empty to save converted videos directly into <b><i>/output/</i></b>.</li><li>Use the special value <b><i>SAME_AS_SRC</i></b> to use the same subfolder as the source. For example, if the video source file is <b><i>/watch/Movies/mymovie.mkv</i></b>, the converted video will be written to <b><i>/output/Movies/</i></b>.</li><li>Use any subfolder name. For example, setting the value <b><i>Home/Movies</i></b> will make converted videos written to <b><i>/output/Home/Movies</i></b>/</li></ul>

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Source File Stable Time
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of a video file in the watch folder need to remain the same. This is to avoid processing a file that is being copied.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Minimum Title Duration
Config.Description: Minimum title duration (in seconds). Shorter titles will be ignored. This applies only to video disc sources (ISO file, <i>VIDEO_TS</i> folder or <i>BDMV</i> folder).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Check Interval
Config.Description: Interval (in seconds) at which the automatic video converter checks for new files.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Number of Watch Folders
Config.Description: Maximum number of watch folders handled by the automatic video converter.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Disable Progress in GUI
Config.Description: Set to 1 to disable display of the video conversion progress in HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Custom HandBrake Arguments
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to HandBrake when performing a conversion.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Install Packages
Config.Description: Space-separated list of Alpine Linux packages to install. This is useful when the automatic video converter's hooks require requires tools not available in the container image. See <i>https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org</i> for the list of available Alpine Linux packages.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used.
